sentence: Among the largest retail spending periods in the U.S. are Mother's Day and Father's Day.
Mother's Day is the more prominent of the two and is the third largest retail holiday.
Earlier this year, the National Retail Federation (NRF) had projected that sales on Mother's Day would come in at $21.2 billion.
A survey from the NRF released last week estimates that sales for Father's Day will come in at $12.7 billion.
This survey projects that average expenditure on gifts per person will come in at $115.57.
This is marginally higher than last year's average of $113.80.
Another important finding is that 75.4% of the population intends to celebrate Father's Day.
According to the NRF's President and CEO Matthew Shay, retailers will benefit from the combined impetus provided by the beginning of summer and Father's Day.
The first half of 2015 has been a relatively slow time for stores and the end of the chill and the large volume of shoppers will spark off the buying spree associated with summer.
Retailers will gain from this much needed boost during the second half of the year.
After all, June marks the official commencement of summer.
Sales of products associated with summer are expected to increase on Father's Day.
This includes patio and grilling equipment, pool gear, clothing, sporting goods as well as other products popular at this time.
Experience related purchases will top spending on Father's Day.
On the whole, 43.3% of consumers will spend $2.6 billion on such items, including ballgame tickets or a memorable family meal.
At $1.7 billion, apparel sales are projected to lead spending on gifts.
Brands from this category will be among the primary gainers of Father's Day spending.
Among them are Nike NKE , which has benefited from the current "athleisure" fashion trend that has led to workout clothes and footwear becoming leisure clothing.
Under Armour UA is another such stock which will gain from substantial expenditure on leisure and sporting goods.
The largest U.S. seller of sneakers in the U.S., Foot Locker FL is also expected to gain from Father's Day spending.
Expenditure on consumer electronics and accessories related to computers will come in second with $1.6 billion worth of estimated purchases.
This could lead to gains for Apple AAPL .
Latest products from the company such as the iPhone 6 or the Apple Watch may attract a significant number of consumers during this period.
The NRF survey also predicts that $710 million will be spent on gardening supplies and home improvement.
This is good news for the likes of Home Depot HD and Lowe's Companies LOW , the world's leading home improvement retailers.
Such sales are all expected to be beneficial for retailers, both online and brick and mortar.
Among prominent brick and mortar companies which will gain are the likes of Macy's M , Best Buy BBY and J.C. Penney JCP .
These stores sell a range of products including apparel, accessories and electronics.
On the whole, higher sales on Father's Day will boost stocks expected to gain from the optimism generated from this day.
